page.title: 05LIFESTYLES VILLAGE MORELEIGH
page.content:
In the 18th Century a Barony, later an Earldom and Viscounty was granted to the Parkers of Saltram by George 111rd - the head of the family took the title of Lord Morley as they then owned the village. The present Lord Morley is Lord Lieutenant of Devon.
The Totnes District Plan 1984 is of the opinion that small scale development in this area is desirable and would be beneficial to the community,which has decreased significantly in the past 50 years. There is 0.9 acres with potential for conversions and infill development - if all the allowance was taken up this could increase the population by between thirty and forty, which would be a significant growth compared to the preceding decade.
